it.gmariotti.cardslib.library.view
Class CardView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.LinearLayout
              it.gmariotti.cardslib.library.view.BaseCardView
                  it.gmariotti.cardslib.library.view.CardView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, CardViewInterface
public class CardView
extends BaseCardView

Card view

Use an XML layout file to display it.

First, you need an XML layout that will display the Card.
Then create a model: 


     //Create a Card
     Card card = new Card(getContext());

     //Create a CardHeader
     CardHeader header = new CardHeader(getContext());

     //Add Header to card
     card.addCardHeader(header);
Last get a reference to the `CardView` from your code, and set your `Card. 

     //Set card in the cardView
     CardView cardView = (CardView) getActivity().findViewById(R.id.carddemo);

     cardView.setCard(card);
You can easily build your layout.

The quickest way to start with this would be to copy one of this files and create your layout. Then you can inflate your layout in the `CardView` using the attr: `card:card_layout_resourceID="@layout/my_layout` Example:
